commit_message:
Vagrantfile: Increase VM memory requirements to 6GB

Running the os_tempest role on Vagrant VMs often leads to the following
error:

==> ubuntu1604: TASK [galera_client : Add keys (primary keyserver)] ****************************
==> ubuntu1604: ERROR! Unexpected Exception, this is probably a bug: [Errno 12] Cannot allocate memory
==> ubuntu1604: to see the full traceback, use -vvv
==> ubuntu1604: ERROR: InvocationError for command '/bin/bash -c /vagrant/tests/common/test-ansible-functional.sh' (exited with code 250)

As such lets increase the memory requirements to 6GB. Moreover, we
switch to the Bento boxes which come with 65GB of diskspace and they are
all built from a central place. Hopefully, this will bring some
uniformity across the Vagrant VMs. This also removes the
openSUSE Leap 42.2 configuration since it's reached EOL.

Change-Id: Iba357117d19670f245e999ffdeb5c954d76443e8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-tests refs/changes/53/564153/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: v.memory = 6144 xenial.vm.box = "bento/ubuntu-16.04" leap423.vm.box = "bento/opensuse-leap-42.3" centos7.vm.box = "bento/centos-7"
deleted_lines: v.memory = 4096 xenial.disksize.size = "40GB" xenial.vm.box = "ubuntu/xenial64" end config.vm.define "opensuse422" do |leap422| leap422.vm.box = "opensuse/openSUSE-42.2-x86_64" leap423.vm.box = "opensuse/openSUSE-42.3-x86_64" centos7.vm.box = "centos/7"

commit_message:
Add queue_name parameter to ffwd_converge

FFU: ceph upgrade fails and exits with 'queue_name'. It looks that
the upgrade completed ok but in the end it exits with the
'queue_name'. This is caused by missing parameter.

Change-Id: I7cd59c7e4f0c75db1bb3fa34cd61e3c307a8d4eb
Resolves: rhbz#1573327
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-tripleoclient refs/changes/54/566354/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: package_update.ffwd_converge_nodes( clients, container=stack_name, queue_name=constants.CEPH_UPGRADE_QUEUE)

commit_message:
Make manila-ui python3 compatible

In order to make manila-ui python3 compatible,
this patch set:
- replace dict.iteritems() with six.iteritems(dict)
- replace print msg with print(msg)
- replace dict.viewkeys() with error.keys()
- python 3 getting the keys() of a dict returns
  a dict_keys object instead of a list and hence
  sort() fails
- in python 2.x calling keys makes a copy of the key
  that you can iterate over while modifying the dict.
  This doesn't work in python 3.x because keys
  returns an iterator instead of a list.
  Another way is to use list to force a copy of the keys
  to be made.
- use getattr instead of relying on overriden __getattr__
  in the client to get params that not neccesarily need to
  be available (share_group_id and supports_share_migration)
- refactor ShareGroupTypeTests

Plus, enable py35 and py35dj20 jobs in tox and drop
old oslo-incubator files (install_venv.py)

Also add openstack-tox-py35 job to check python3 env.
openstack-tox-py35 should be defined in project-config later
but it is added to check python3 UT status.

Change-Id: I30582184904dc19e9cb4ca171b1fd2d161e09c48

commit_message:
Add no-tls environment to env-generator

It was missed from the commit that introduced the environment.

Change-Id: I7e370f5b16ba8b29cd1af36fec6da436f70843a6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/19/566919/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # ******************************************************************* # This file was created automatically by the sample environment # generator. Developers should use `tox -e genconfig` to update it. # Users are recommended to make changes to a copy of the file instead # of the original, if any customizations are needed. # ******************************************************************* # title: Deploy All Endpoints without TLS and with IP addresses # description: | # Use this environment when deploying an overcloud where all the endpoints not # using TLS and are using IP addresses. parameter_defaults: # Whether to enable TLS on the public interface or not. # Type: boolean EnablePublicTLS: False # Mapping of service endpoint -> protocol. Typically set via parameter_defaults in the resource registry. # Type: json EndpointMap: AodhAdmin: {protocol: http, port: '8042', host: IP_ADDRESS} AodhInternal: {protocol: http, port: '8042', host: commit_message:
Update tox.ini to stop using unverified package

As of pip 10.0, --allow-unverified is not permitted.

Use of the flag in this repo was previously used to force
installation of python-apt to accommodate certain unit tests.

The unverified package, python-apt, is no longer necessary
for test execution.

Change-Id: I3bb8af99cd8303c105f85a4712ca0b057994ef7d
Related-Bug: #1760720
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charms.openstack refs/changes/69/567269/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: pip install {opts} {packages}

subject: WIP: ovs: Put switch port done before it's wired
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-05-09 13:49:45.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/openvswitch/agent/ovs_neutron_agent.py', 'neutron/agent/linux/interface.py', 'neutron/agent/common/ovs_lib.py', 'neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/openvswitch/agent/openflow/ovs_ofctl/ofswitch.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/3100ed9c0c10507d36aab2c5e8ed81fdaf0d6f6e', 'message': "WIP: ovs: Put switch port done before it's wired

Change interface driver to be put down on switch side when plug() driver
method is called. This is to avoid any traffic unwanted inboud or
outbound traffic for the port before it's properly wired by an L2 agent.
Also the port is left down in case binding fails for unexpected reason
instead of leaving attached port without local VLAN tag and hence in
trunk mode. Such ports were able to communicate among themselves when
binding failed or before the wiring was finished.

Closes-bug: #1767422

Change-Id: Icab78d6c34a76328409c5d90c3b5ad5536fbb88f
"}]
commit_message:
WIP: ovs: Put switch port done before it's wired

Change interface driver to be put down on switch side when plug() driver
method is called. This is to avoid any traffic unwanted inboud or
outbound traffic for the port before it's properly wired by an L2 agent.
Also the port is left down in case binding fails for unexpected reason
instead of leaving attached port without local VLAN tag and hence in
trunk mode. Such ports were able to communicate among themselves when
binding failed or before the wiring was finished.

Closes-bug: #1767422

Change-Id: Icab78d6c34a76328409c5d90c3b5ad5536fbb88f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/25/567225/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Do not create nova db user if database unchanged

This change prevents the task running if the database
has not been changed when a preconfigured external
database is not in use. This was the behaviour before
the preconfigured database feature was introduced.

Close-Bug: 1763375
Change-Id: I4f68905732dac75bc0deddab88047c9c0d7d65b5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible refs/changes/03/560903/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: when: database.changed or not use_preconfigured_databases | bool

commit_message:
Debian is using Python 3

This patch fixes numerous issues with puppet-ironic assuming that Debian
uses Python 2.7.

Change-Id: I166ebf38df22f4f819303c60fff93e77c260fd1e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-ironic refs/changes/43/567143/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: :name => platform_params[:pymysql_package_name], let(:platform_params) do case facts[:osfamily] when 'Debian' if facts[:os_package_type] == 'debian' then pymysql_pkgname = 'python3-pymysql' else pymysql_pkgname = 'python-pymysql' end { :pymysql_package_name = pymysql_pkgname, } when 'RedHat' :pymysql_package_name = 'python-pymysql', end end

commit_message:
Introduce new header for system-scoped tokens

Keystonemiddleware attempts to parse user/service tokens and populate
request headers for other services to consume. This information is
important for services looking to build oslo.context objects from
request environments.

Change-Id: I0717c2a5207a647999b4f9bcdf11f728984f0812
Closes-Bug: 1766731

subject: Add support for remote consumers of Ceilometer event data.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-05-04 07:58:27.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/charm-ceilometer/commit/38111f84bd47c49d98a28eb06492ad84750d706a', 'message': 'Add support for remote consumers of Ceilometer event data.

There is a use-case to forward events received by ceilometer from
OpenStack services to an external system via http/udp. It comes
from the fact that aodh does not include all information about an
event alarm into POSTed data. Raw event data can be published by
ceilometer via http/udp to an external system without giving a
user direct access to rabbitmq.

This patch adds a context generator and associated templates and
configuration for configuring multiple event-sinks in
/etc/ceilometer/event_pipeline.yaml. Also adds support for future
Panko charm event consumer in the same context.

Closes Bug: 1763321

Change-Id: I931438c720272bd9a3d2b958ebabcd3584790bd0
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2018-05-04 09:45:43.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/charm-ceilometer/commit/c5960ccfdb45eca0daba223b1245fcbbb4fe35c0', 'message': 'Add support for remote consumers of Ceilometer event data.

There is a use-case to forward events received by ceilometer from
OpenStack services to an external system via http/udp. It comes
from the fact that aodh does not include all information about an
event alarm into POSTed data. Raw event data can be published by
ceilometer via http/udp to an external system without giving a
user direct access to rabbitmq.

the event-service interface in the above context with associated
metadata and hook symlinks.

Closes Bug: 1763321

commit_message:
Add support for remote consumers of Ceilometer event data.

There is a use-case to forward events received by ceilometer from
OpenStack services to an external system via http/udp. It comes
from the fact that aodh does not include all information about an
event alarm into POSTed data. Raw event data can be published by
ceilometer via http/udp to an external system without giving a
user direct access to rabbitmq.

This patch adds a context generator, associated templates, and
configuration entry for configuring multiple event-sinks in
/etc/ceilometer/event_pipeline.yaml. This also modifies the
ceilometer.conf templates to reflect the correct naming of the
same file to align with upstream Ceilometer.

Also adds support for a future Panko charm event consumer using
the event-service interface in the above context with associated
metadata and hook symlinks.

This change will only effect Mitaka and later clouds.

Closes Bug: 1763321

Change-Id: I931438c720272bd9a3d2b958ebabcd3584790bd0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charm-ceilometer refs/changes/34/566234/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: class RemoteSinksContext(OSContextGenerator): def __call__(self): '''Writes /etc/ceilomter/pipeline.yaml with remote sinks for Panko and other compatible remotes. ''' ctxt = {} if config('remote-sink'): ctxt['remote_sinks'] = config('remote-sink').split(' ') for relid in relation_ids('event-service'): for unit in related_units(relid): panko_sink_url = relation_get('panko_sink_url', unit=unit, rid=relid) if panko_sink_url: ctxt['panko_sink'] = panko_sink_url break return ctxt

Upstream CI job doesn't get to start the

failing in mistral. This patch adds the
--validation-errors-nonfatal when the

Change-Id: I7b4091a4603688b19669ff70afcfa852984a820e

commit_message:
Add validation-errors-nonfatal in ceph upgrade.

Upstream CI job doesn't get to start the
ceph upgrade as the pre-validations are
failing in mistral. This patch adds the
--validation-errors-nonfatal when the
tripleo_upgrade_validations_non_fatal
parameters is set to true.

Change-Id: I7b4091a4603688b19669ff70afcfa852984a820e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-upgrade refs/changes/93/567193/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: -e {{ _env }} \ {% if tripleo_upgrade_validations_non_fatal|bool %} --validation-errors-nonfatal \ {% endif %}

commit_message:
Change template names to rocky

The new master branch should point now to rocky.

So, HOT templates should specify that they might contain features
for rocky release [1]

Also, this submission updates the yaml validation to use only latest
heat_version alias. There are cases in which we will need to set
the version for specific templates i.e. mixed versions, so there
is added a variable to assign specific templates to specific heat_version
aliases, avoiding the introductions of error by bulk replacing the
the old version in new releases.

[1]: https://docs.openstack.org/heat/latest/template_guide/hot_spec.html#rocky
Change-Id: Ib17526d9cc453516d99d4659ee5fa51a5aa7fb4b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/41/549841/12 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: heat_template_version: rocky

subject: UC: validate paths for tht templates and env files
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-04-13 11:00:19.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-tripleoclient/commit/9364b22d1b2952b05e4209fe987d6be8cb94b590', 'message': 'Validate paths for tht templates dir vs env files

The --templates path must match the -e path, e.g:

openstack overcloud upgrade prepare \
  --templates ~/tripleo-heat-templates
  -e ~/tripleo-heat-templates/*.yaml

Though, there are totally valid cases when --templates is
mixed with auto generated -e files residing in either temp
dirs or the user's home dir. For example, heat undercloud
installer generates such files. So we can not blindly
prohibit non matching --templates and -e's.

To adress that UX issue, add additional contstraints for
overcloud and undercloud tht env files validation:

* "-e" files with abs paths not matching the given abs
  tht templates path shall not contain resource_registry.
* Only log a warning, when the non-matching path belongs
  to an env file w/o a resource_registry.

Closes-bug: #1762403

Change-Id: Ia9c62c787d6c581a66b2fde030a60499cfa18b82
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2018-04-24 15:23:41.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-tripleoclient/commit/d33ce9149d1f626bfcd3e7af740e593c0a52108d', 'message': 'UC: validate paths for tht templates and env files

The --templates path must match the -e path, e.g:

openstack overcloud upgrade prepare \
  --templates ~/tripleo-heat-templates
  -e ~/tripleo-heat-templates/*.yaml

Though, there are totally valid cases when --templates is
mixed with auto generated -e files residing in either temp
dirs or the user's home dir. For example, heat undercloud
installer generates such files. So we can not blindly
prohibit non matching --templates and -e's.

To adress that UX issue, add additional contstraints for
undercloud tht env files validation:

* "-e" files can not refer external files normally
  processed from jinja2 in t-h-t. Those must come from
  the templates path only.

NOTE: the similar change for overcloud should be done
in follow-ups.

  --templates ~/tripleo-heat-templates
  -e ~/tripleo-heat-templates/*.yaml

Though, there are totally valid cases when --templates is
mixed with auto generated -e files residing in either temp
dirs or the user's home dir. For example, heat undercloud
installer generates such files. So we can not blindly
prohibit non matching --templates and -e's.

To adress that UX issue, add additional contstraints for
undercloud tht env files validation:

* "-e" files can not refer external files normally
  processed from jinja2 in t-h-t. Those must come from
  the templates path only.

NOTE: the similar change for overcloud should be done
in follow-ups.

commit_message:
UC: validate paths for tht templates and env files

The --templates path must match the -e path, e.g:

openstack overcloud upgrade prepare \
  --templates ~/tripleo-heat-templates
  -e ~/tripleo-heat-templates/*.yaml

Though, there are totally valid cases when --templates is
mixed with auto generated -e files residing in either temp
dirs or the user's home dir. For example, heat undercloud
installer generates such files. So we can not blindly
prohibit non matching --templates and -e's.

To adress that UX issue, add additional contstraints for
undercloud tht env files validation:

* "-e" files can not refer external files normally
  processed from jinja2 in t-h-t. Those must come from
  the templates path only.

NOTE: the similar change for overcloud should be done
in follow-ups.

Partial-bug: #1762403

Depends-On: I10d4dffcd3802f62fc824c808728c0b5b4f1002c
Change-Id: Ia9c62c787d6c581a66b2fde030a60499cfa18b82
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-tripleoclient refs/changes/92/561192/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _validate_env_files_paths(self, parsed_args): tht_path = parsed_args.templates or constants.TRIPLEO_HEAT_TEMPLATES if parsed_args.environment_files: for env_file in parsed_args.environment_files: if (os.path.dirname(os.path.abspath(env_file)) != os.path.abspath(tht_path)): with open(env_file, 'r') as f: env_map = yaml.safe_load(f) env_registry = env_map.get('resource_registry', {}) if env_registry != {}: raise ValueError( _("External to %s env files " "are not allowed to contain " "'resource_registry':") % os.path.abspath(tht_path) + os.path.abspath(env_file)) else: self.log.warning( _("External to %s env files " "are not recommended for use:") % os.path.abspath(tht_path) + os.path.abspath(env_file)) self._validate_env_files_paths(parsed_args)

commit_message:
Add EnablePublicTLS flag

This flag is on by default, and serves to enable (or disable) the
public TLS by default feature.

It differs from the PublicSSLCertificateAutogenerated flag in the fact
that it works with mistral, while PublicSSLCertificateAutogenerated
works with certmonger in the overcloud.

Change-Id: If553ecff26d5ecd529c37ca438e0ba1795e9ecca
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/18/564518/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- features: - | This adds a flag called EnablePublicTLS, which defaults to 'true'. It reflects that Public TLS is enabled by default, and it's read by the deployment workflow to let the public certificate generation happen. It can also be used to disable this feature, if it's set to 'false' as it's done in the no-tls-endpoints-public-ip.yaml environment file, which allows deployers to turn this feature off.

commit_message:
Find deployment name in config download

In some cases we get a ResourceGroup as parent resource of a deployment,
so the name will be a number. Ansible will be unhappy with that, so
let's get the grand parent to get the proper name.

Change-Id: Icc64b32a2179cd10853a54a83bf82a1761297ebd
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-common refs/changes/43/561943/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: try: int(deployment_name) except ValueError: pass else: # We can't have an integer here, let's figure out the # grandparent resource name deployment_stack_id = \ deployment.attributes['value']['deployment'].split('/')[-1] deployment_stack = self.client.stacks.get( deployment_stack_id, resolve_outputs=False) parent_stack = deployment_stack.parent resource= self.client.resources.list( name, nested_depth=constants.NESTED_DEPTH, filters=dict(physical_resource_id=parent_stack)) if not resources: message = "The deployment resource grandparent name could" \ "not be determined." raise ValueError(message) deployment_name = resources[0].name

commit_message:
Add config option for Barbican endpoint type

This change willl allow the user to specify the endpoint
type for Barbican.  The allowed values are: public, internal,
and admin.  The default value will be 'public' since this is
the current value.

Change-Id: Ic89519ed3a9c347a9fff245ec231aa575b42f1ac
Closes-bug: 1767473

As we discovered bug #1768586 we'll need to make sure that every
parameter tweak in plan is followed by a stack update.

So far the Ceph upgrade command did set param -> stack update -> unset
param (only in plan). However this means the last CephAnsiblePlaybook
setting (back to normal deploy playbook) was discarded.

Let's reuse normal converge commands to converge CephAnsiblePlaybook
too, and we can remove the (now unused) ceph-upgrade-converge.yaml. We
won't do more stack updates than necessary, and at the same time the
user workflow stays somewhat consistent between envs that do and don't
have Ceph.

An alternative would be to run the as part of the Ceph command, but
that either means we'd have to run one more stack update then
necessary, or skip the last converge in envs with Ceph, and
essentially diverge further from the non-Ceph workflow.

Change-Id: If596531cbb1e750ed67e66391743f4c1833e4337

commit_message:
Set normal CephAnsiblePlaybook on update/upgrade/ffwd converge

As we discovered bug #1768586 we'll need to make sure that every
parameter tweak in plan is followed by a stack update.

So far the Ceph upgrade command did set param -> stack update -> unset
param (only in plan). However this means the last CephAnsiblePlaybook
setting (back to normal deploy playbook) was discarded.

Let's reuse normal converge commands to converge CephAnsiblePlaybook
too, and we can remove the (now unused) ceph-upgrade-converge.yaml. We
won't do more stack updates than necessary, and at the same time the
user workflow stays somewhat consistent between envs that do and don't
have Ceph.

An alternative would be to run the as part of the Ceph command, but
that either means we'd have to run one more stack update then
necessary, or skip the last converge in envs with Ceph, and
essentially diverge further from the non-Ceph workflow.

Change-Id: If596531cbb1e750ed67e66391743f4c1833e4337
Depends-On: I025eac40f8bda5f23c789e7fef1a9e9b49947f66
Partial-Bug: #1768586

commit_message:
Remove unused tox_install.sh

This repo does not use tox_install.sh, remove it.

We're in the process of replacing it everywhere, removing an unused file
is an easy win.

Change-Id: If988ea839ffb1e03bd287ea6ecc4ce640338df6e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-validations refs/changes/82/524482/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: #!/usr/bin/env bash # Client constraint file contains this client version pin that is in conflict # with installing the client from source. We should remove the version pin in # the constraints file before applying it for from-source installation. CONSTRAINTS_FILE="$1" shift 1 set -e # NOTE(tonyb): Place this in the tox enviroment's log dir so it will get # published to logs.openstack.org for easy debugging. localfile="$VIRTUAL_ENV/log/upper-constraints.txt" if [[ "$CONSTRAINTS_FILE" != http* ]]; then CONSTRAINTS_FILE="file://$CONSTRAINTS_FILE" fi # NOTE(tonyb): need to add curl to bindep.txt if the project supports bindep curl "$CONSTRAINTS_FILE" --insecure --progress-bar --output "$localfile" pip install -c"$localfile" openstack-requirements # This is the main purpose of the script: Allow local installation of # the current repo. It is listed in constraints file and thus any # install will be constrained and we need to unconstrain it. edit-constraints "$localfile" -- "$CLIENT_NAME" pip install -c"$localfile" -U "$@" exit $?

commit_message:
Remove the inexistence script

the 000-install-packages.sh script depend on the code clone, so when
install the packages, the 000-install-packages.sh not exists, we
can't run the script directly, this PS to remove it.

Change-Id: I0a53fbc5b4b79a9bd55f28700b46e61baec423da

commit_message:
Configure cors for glance for additional usability

In order to enable image uploads in horizon we need to configure several
things in glance, namely cors. This change implements default overrides
allowing the system to provide for direct image uploads through horizon
which will greatly improve our usability, especially for new users.

Change-Id: I19f4027dd30b0ba22cbb195c676802ce908d3e8f
Closes-Bug: #1747684
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Fix dropped check for boot_index 0 in _validate_bdm

This reverts commit 7f4b49c9c97e06babf82f6846c804ad176cd4cde.

During refactor change I8a3e7e6c4b72eb1c3707d54049d18dc29f606fe5
the conditional that at least one BDM had to be the boot
device was inadvertantly dropped, presumably because there was
no test for that case.

The validation is added back here along with a test.

Change-Id: I299bf846b658f2bb6903c898d7deac748f8d90e4
Related-Bug: #1766306
(cherry picked from commit b9815c2331904a3749269289b861229796aa6c91)

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-01 19:51:01.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart/commit/46c6d8e6bb212204c5b54c337b73132f0e6b0c98', 'message': "Use md5sum -b on images

according to md5sum man page

-b, --binary
      read in binary mode

The  sums  are  computed  as  described in RFC 1321.  When checking, the input
should be a former output of this program.  The default mode is to print a line
with checksum, a space, a character indicating input mode ('*' for binary, ' '
for text or where binary is insignificant), and name for each FILE.

the ramification is that this can be different if read binary is different from
from normal read on a given platform.  The binary option is better if you know
what you are trying to check is a binary blob.

commit_message:
Use md5sum -b on images

according to md5sum man page

-b, --binary
      read in binary mode

The  sums  are  computed  as  described in RFC 1321.  When checking, the input
should be a former output of this program.  The default mode is to print a line
with checksum, a space, a character indicating input mode ('*' for binary, ' '
for text or where binary is insignificant), and name for each FILE.

the ramification is that this can be different if read binary is different from
from normal read on a given platform.  The binary option is better if you know
what you are trying to check is a binary blob.

Change-Id: Ib1490feefe4e026b3834a40ae9072a82af1379ee

commit_message:
conf: Remove deprecated 'multi_instance_display_name_template' opt

This flag was deprecated in a previous cycle. The flag and any uses of
it can now be removed.

There is still a bit of simplification that can now be done around this
feature, but this is kept separate to avoid confusing matters.

Change-Id: I8ae8507a089df4d0a32be5fbc615e2166f44516e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/12/499612/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _populate_instance_names(self, instance, num_instances, index): hostname = (instance.get('hostname') if 'hostname' in instance else None) # if booting multiple instances, we must suffix them to prevent # collisions if num_instances > 1 and self.cell_type != 'api': display_name = '%s-%d' % (display_name, index + 1) instance.display_name = display_name if hostname is None: # we try our best to use the display name but provide a fallback # for some funkier names (all unicode, for example) instance.hostname = utils.sanitize_hostname(display_name, self._populate_instance_names(instance, num_instances, index)
deleted_lines: def _new_instance_name_from_template(self, uuid, display_name, index): params = { 'uuid': uuid, 'name': display_name, 'count': index + 1, } try: new_name = (CONF.multi_instance_display_name_template % params) except (KeyError, TypeError): LOG.exception('Failed to set instance name using ' 'multi_instance_display_name_template.') new_name = display_name return new_name def _apply_instance_name_template(self, context, instance, index): original_name = instance.display_name new_name = self._new_instance_name_from_template(instance.uuid, instance.display_name, index) instance.display_name = new_name if not instance.get('hostname', None): if utils.sanitize_hostname(original_name) == "": instance.hostname = self._default_host_name(instance.uuid) else: instance.hostname = utils.sanitize_hostname(new_name) return instance def _populate_instance_names(self, instance, num_instances): if instance.obj_attr_is_set('hostname'): hostname = instance.get('hostname') else: hostname = None if hostname is None and num_instances == 1: # NOTE(russellb) In the multi-instance case, we're going to # overwrite the display_name using the # multi_instance_display_name_template. We need the default # display_name set so that it can be used in the template, though. # Only set the hostname here if we're only creating one instance. # Otherwise, it will be built after the template based # display_name. hostname = display_name instance.hostname = utils.sanitize_hostname(hostname, self._populate_instance_names(instance, num_instances) if num_instances > 1 and self.cell_type != 'api': instance = self._apply_instance_name_template(context, instance, index)

commit_message:
[scenario] Add test case to check for RO access

Test if a compute instance with RO access granted to it via floating
IP address fails to write on the share. Also, add the capability to
pass the access level to the methods that allow access to shares.

Change-Id: I1aef8f1ed1b93c0847a6aa982f62c8e539d04337
Signed-off-by: Rishabh Dave <ridave@redhat.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/manila-tempest-plugin refs/changes/19/544519/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def allow_access_ip(self, share_id, ip=None, instance=None, access_level="rw", cleanup=True, snapshot=None): access_to=ip, cleanup=cleanup) else: return self._allow_access(share_id, access_type='ip', access_to=ip, access_level=access_level, cleanup=cleanup, client=self.shares_v2_client) def deny_access_ip(self, share_id, rule_id): return self._deny_access(share_id, rule_id) @tc.attr(base.TAG_NEGATIVE, base.TAG_BACKEND) def test_write_with_ro_access(self): '''Test if an instance with ro access can write on the share.''' test_data = "Some test data to write" instance = self.boot_instance(wait_until="BUILD") self.create_share() # Get floating IP address before allowing access. ssh_client_inst = self.init_ssh(instance) ip = self.floatings[instance['id']]['ip'] access_rule_id = self.allow_access_ip(self.share['id'], ip=ip, cleanup=False)['id'] location = self._get_user_export_locations(self.share)[0] instance = self.wait_for_active_instance(instance["id"]) self.mount_share(location, ssh_client_inst) self.addCleanup(self.umount_share, ssh_client_inst) self.write_data(test_data, ssh_client_inst) access = self.deny_access_ip(self.share['id'], access_rule_id) self.allow_access_ip(self.share['id'], instance=instance, access_level="ro", cleanup=True) self.assertRaises(exceptions.SSHExecCommandFailed, self.write_data, test_data, ssh_client_inst)
deleted_lines: def allow_access_ip(self, share_id, ip=None, instance=None, cleanup=True, snapshot=None): access_to=ip, cleanup=cleanup) else: self._allow_access(share_id, access_type='ip', access_to=ip, cleanup=cleanup, client=self.shares_v2_client)

commit_message:
Debian: fix barbican-api setup

Currently, it's not possible to use eventlet in Debian because the test
has been made on $::osfamily == 'Debian' instead of $::os_package_type.

Also, in Debian, the barbican-api service was never stopped before
configuring Apache, therefore, starting Apache just failed.

This patch also adds the $::barbican::params::api_service_name var if
using Debian packages.

Change-Id: Ide559f8fdc58ed3539325acd6696cec23c3de65b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-barbican refs/changes/23/566923/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if $::os_package_type == 'ubuntu' { fail('With Ubuntu packages the service_name must be set to httpd as there is no eventlet init script.')
deleted_lines: if $::osfamily == 'Debian' { fail('On Debian family the service_name must be set to httpd as there is no eventlet init script.')

commit_message:
Debian: correctly set placement endpoint

When using Debian's uwsgi setup, we don't use /placement in the URL. This
patch fixes it.

Change-Id: I88aa6894eeb175fe20c6f9f0812cb8a6d747a558
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-openstack-integration refs/changes/07/566907/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if ($::os_package_type == 'debian') { class { '::nova::keystone::auth_placement': public_url => "${::openstack_integration::config::base_url}:8778", internal_url => "${::openstack_integration::config::base_url}:8778", admin_url => "${::openstack_integration::config::base_url}:8778", password => 'a_big_secret', } } else { class { '::nova::keystone::auth_placement': public_url => "${::openstack_integration::config::base_url}:8778/placement", internal_url => "${::openstack_integration::config::base_url}:8778/placement", admin_url => "${::openstack_integration::config::base_url}:8778/placement", password => 'a_big_secret', }

commit_message:
Allow monkeypatching CONFIG_FILES

The patch to rip out the guts of os-client-config did not allow someone
to monkeypatch os_client_config.config.CONFIG_FILES. The nodepool test
suite was doing this - and so we're not sure who else might have been.

If we put the consumption of those into a wrapper constructor, we can
allow that to happen still.

Change-Id: Ibf676ecc9d28ee99d2bbfaccd9384b4ae590daf4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/os-client-config refs/changes/39/566139/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def __init__(self, config_files=None, vendor_files=None, override_defaults=None, force_ipv4=None, envvar_prefix=None, secure_files=None, pw_func=None, session_constructor=None, app_name=None, app_version=None, load_yaml_config=True, load_envvars=True): # Handle people having monkeypatches these globals if loader.CONFIG_FILES != CONFIG_FILES: config_files = CONFIG_FILES if loader.SECURE_FILES != SECURE_FILES: secure_files = SECURE_FILES if loader.VENDOR_FILES != VENDOR_FILES: vendor_files = VENDOR_FILES super(OpenStackConfig, self).__init__( config_files=config_files, vendor_files=vendor_files, override_defaults=override_defaults, force_ipv4=force_ipv4, envvar_prefix=envvar_prefix, secure_files=secure_files, pw_func=pw_func, session_constructor=session_constructor, app_name=app_name, app_version=app_version, load_yaml_config=load_yaml_config, load_envvars=load_envvars, )

subject: Gate fix: Cap hacking to avoid gate failure
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-05-09 01:04:51.000000000', 'files': ['test-requirements.txt'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/networking-generic-switch/commit/f3e042fcf570584da1c7fa284d3353fb69953dd4', 'message': 'Gate fix: Cap hacking to avoid gate failure

hacking is not capped in g-r and it is in
blacklist for requirement as hacking new version
can break the gate jobs.

Hacking can break gate jobs because of various
reasons:
- There might be new rule addition in hacking
- Some rules becomes default from non-default
- Updates in pycodestyle etc

That was the main reason it was not added in g-r
auto sync also. Most of the project maintained the
compatible and cap the hacking version in
test-requirements.txt and update to new version when
project is ready. Bumping new version might need code
fix also on project side depends on what new in that
version.

If project does not have cap the hacking version then,
there is possibility of gate failure whenever new hacking
version is released by QA team.

Example of such failure in recent release of hacking 1.1.0
- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-May/130282.html

Change-Id: Ia8c279e170951441fcdf9f1ffc4a699a9da8c3fe
'}]
commit_message:
Gate fix: Cap hacking to avoid gate failure

hacking is not capped in g-r and it is in
blacklist for requirement as hacking new version
can break the gate jobs.

Hacking can break gate jobs because of various
reasons:
- There might be new rule addition in hacking
- Some rules becomes default from non-default
- Updates in pycodestyle etc

That was the main reason it was not added in g-r
auto sync also. Most of the project maintained the
compatible and cap the hacking version in
test-requirements.txt and update to new version when
project is ready. Bumping new version might need code
fix also on project side depends on what new in that
version.

If project does not have cap the hacking version then,
there is possibility of gate failure whenever new hacking
version is released by QA team.

Example of such failure in recent release of hacking 1.1.0
- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-May/130282.html

Change-Id: Ia8c279e170951441fcdf9f1ffc4a699a9da8c3fe
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-generic-switch refs/changes/85/567085/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Add support for more aodh alarm types:
- composite
- gnocchi_aggregation_by_metrics_threshold
- gnocchi_aggregation_by_resources_threshold

Change-Id: If3b4a9eae645c27d47d865b85c0d3fbbb1fce99b

commit_message:
Remove Openstack and Ceph packages attempt 2

As we've switched to containers, it's time to start cleaning up the
packages we install on the overcloud images by default. This change
removes all the openstack and ceph packages from the
overcloud-controller, overcloud-ceph-storage and overcloud-compute
elements.

This reverts commit c69d6dd2c9d1c54d82669525bababc04b5a0688c. The
previous attempt was reverted due to an invalid json in the overcloud
pkg-map. This trailing comma has been addressed in this revert.

Change-Id: I5ceb329e18024040697ad5eab892d13c51ad276f
Related-Blueprint: cleanup-overcloud-images

commit_message:
Enforce removal of container network namespace.

This patch enforces the removal of the container
network namespace when the environment is destroyed.

Closes-Bug: #1769651

Change-Id: I9b0bbbb5a59e6067a745635c555051ef97b79f9a
Signed-off-by: Jorge Niedbalski <jorge.niedbalski@linaro.org>
(cherry picked from commit 6c5a6c65f11008b484551267e24ee04e73280232)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible refs/changes/73/566873/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: echo "Disconnecting containers from docker host network" for container in ${containers_to_kill}; do (docker network disconnect -f host $container 2>&1) > /dev/null done

commit_message:
Add "also-notifies" option

This patchset adds "also-notifies" option which is an optional part
of the "pools.yaml" configuration and should only be used to define
DNS servers other than the backend servers which should receive
notifications on zone changes.

Change-Id: I10faa6ec4ea4fd1f1f17c7234662cd5c23624c1d
Closes-Bug: 1758008
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charm-designate refs/changes/29/555329/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: {% if options.also_notifies_hosts %} also_notifies: {% for also_notify_host in options.also_notifies_hosts %} - host: {{ also_notify_host.address }} port: {{ also_notify_host.port }}# Workaround for https://bugs.launchpad.net/designate/+bug/1758013 {% else %} also_notifies: []
deleted_lines: also_notifies: {% if dns_backend and dns_backend.pool_config %} {% for slave in dns_backend.pool_config %} - host: {{ slave.address }} port: 53{% endif %} {% if options.pool_config %} {% for slave in options.pool_config %} - host: {{ slave.address }} port: 53 {% endfor %}

commit_message:
Properly set vios_ids when discovering initiator

If vios_ids were not passed to discover_initiator, they get set to
a list of vioses instead of a list of the ids.

Change-Id: If4e2329022f4fb9b81c7b64238defc256bc00f66

commit_message:
Reinstate testing of changes to requirements.txt

Change I0c1328237d2109b1d1d5dcb40f331fff1ab10257 recently prevented
running kolla deployment CI jobs against changes to some files,
including requirements.txt. This change reinstates testing of changes to
requirements.txt, since this can have an effect on the operation of
kolla ansible.

Change-Id: I3d839de9aed60cddebea7d1140f618d3261cca2a

commit_message:
Remove ironic_host_manager usage

The baremetal scheduling options were deprecated
in Pike and the ironic_host_manager was deprecated
in Queens and has now been removed. Deployments
must use resource classes now for baremetal scheduling.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/565805/
Change-Id: I2f3e2821c4c6c68e378816ffc38f863394a45963

commit_message:
Updates the docs with new admin tips

Adds a note on monitoring load balancers handling critical
applications and describes what to do after a node recovery.

Change-Id: I9662703cd55310598335331181aa50bec73ca06c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/octavia refs/changes/35/562035/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Monitoring Load Balancers ------------------------- For critical applications we recommend to monitor the access to the application with a tool which polls the application form various points on the Internet and mesaures response times. Alerts should be triggered when repsonse times become too high. An additional check might be to monitor the provisioning status of a load balancer (see https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/load-balancer/v2/#status-codes) and alert depending on the application (e.g. if it auto-scales pending states are normal) if the provisioning status is not ACTICE. Though, in most cases if a load balancer is not ACTIVE it still might be load balancing (that is why the response time check above is recommended) it is advisable to investigate and potentially replace the load balancer with a fresh one. Handling a VM Node Failure -------------------------- If a node fails which is running amphora, Octavia will automatically failover the amphora to a different node (capacity permitting). In some cases the node can be reovered (e.g. through a hard reset) and the hypervisor might bring back the amphora vms. In this case an operator should manually delete all amphora on this specific node since Octavia assumes they have been deleted as part of the failover and won't touch them again.

commit_message:
Add 'enable-notifications-designate' option

This patchset addss 'enable-notifications-designate' option which
enables 'notifications_designate' notification topic. The topic
should be only enabled in legacy deployments which use notification
topics for the purpose of integrating designate with nova and
neutron.

Change-Id: I1bed2327bf351cd0e56c657dd028ec26a4b68d60
Closes-Bug: #1659943

commit_message:
Revert "Set optional API version-related environment vars"

This reverts commit 6d369703bb1778a11cf55fe679150928cb553cf6.
Before that commit, puppet-openstack was writing in /root/openrc:
export OS_IDENTITY_VERSION=3.1

Since this patch, it doesn't anymore, and everything in Debian is
completely broken: keystone bootstraping fails, image listing fails, etc.

I very much would enjoy having the feature of the reverted patch, but it
should never change the default behavior of setting OS_IDENTITY_VERSION.
I attempted to change the current behavior, keeping this patch, but
failed, so I suggest the original committer to just come back with a
better patch later on, once it's been reverted.

Change-Id: If833e6c9fe7d463e6270ef272295341bbf4c2570
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-openstack_extras refs/changes/31/566831/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Defaults to '3'. $identity_api_version = '3',
deleted_lines: # [*compute_api_version*] # (optional) Compute API version to use. # Defaults to undef. # # [*network_api_version*] # (optional) Network API version to use. # Defaults to undef. # # [*image_api_version*] # (optional) Image API version to use. # Defaults to undef. # # [*volume_api_version*] # (optional) Volume API version to use. # Defaults to undef. ## Defaults to undef. # # [*object_api_version*] # (optional) Object API version to use. # Defaults to undef. $compute_api_version = undef, $network_api_version = undef, $image_api_version = undef, $volume_api_version = undef, $identity_api_version = undef, $object_api_version = undef,

subject: Fix the gate jobs
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-05-09 07:13:43.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible/commit/c2df6d7b1f0ef1acd14284d1a74fc85ff34b1a7d', 'message': 'Gate fix: Cap hacking to avoid gate failure

hacking is not capped in g-r and it is in
blacklist for requirement as hacking new version
can break the gate jobs.

Hacking can break gate jobs because of various
reasons:
- There might be new rule addition in hacking
- Some rules becomes default from non-default
- Updates in pycodestyle etc

That was the main reason it was not added in g-r
auto sync also. Most of the project maintained the
compatible and cap the hacking version in
test-requirements.txt and update to new version when
project is ready. Bumping new version might need code
fix also on project side depends on what new in that
version.

If project does not have cap the hacking version then,
there is possibility of gate failure whenever new hacking
version is released by QA team.

Example of such failure in recent release of hacking 1.1.0
- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-May/130282.html

Change-Id: I05790c5f946a4127fe6c8d9867cc618cb83d67fb
(cherry picked from commit ccd542f7ea26d792ca8a07539f66fac6dfddbfb9)
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2018-05-09 08:32:21.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible/commit/3a2d391cc84f8610d268681a813232d9bb56e5cb', 'message': 'Fix the gate with backport packages

This patch is including two patches to fix the gate.

Gate fix: Cap hacking to avoid gate failure

hacking is not capped in g-r and it is in
blacklist for requirement as hacking new version
can break the gate jobs.

Hacking can break gate jobs because of various
reasons:
- There might be new rule addition in hacking
- Some rules becomes default from non-default
- Updates in pycodestyle etc

That was the main reason it was not added in g-r
auto sync also. Most of the project maintained the
compatible and cap the hacking version in
test-requirements.txt and update to new version when
project is ready. Bumping new version might need code
fix also on project side depends on what new in that
version.

If project does not have cap the hacking version then,
there is possibility of gate failure whenever new hacking
version is released by QA team.

Example of such failure in recent release of hacking 1.1.0
- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-May/130282.html
(cherry picked from commit 197a264a3b772f9d6c9c9775bf00357e2a7a9a10)

Fix deploy-guide links

Deploy guides includes quickstart guide.
Includes respect relative paths, but when
quickstart includes vagrant doc, deploy-guide
tries to locate the doc in its doctree (deploy-guide/source).

This causes error 404 and deploy-guide post-gates to fail
(cherry picked from commit ccd542f7ea26d792ca8a07539f66fac6dfddbfb9)

Change-Id: I05790c5f946a4127fe6c8d9867cc618cb83d67fb

commit_message:
Fix the gate jobs

This patch is including two patches to fix the gate.

Gate fix: Cap hacking to avoid gate failure

hacking is not capped in g-r and it is in
blacklist for requirement as hacking new version
can break the gate jobs.

Hacking can break gate jobs because of various
reasons:
- There might be new rule addition in hacking
- Some rules becomes default from non-default
- Updates in pycodestyle etc

That was the main reason it was not added in g-r
auto sync also. Most of the project maintained the
compatible and cap the hacking version in
test-requirements.txt and update to new version when
project is ready. Bumping new version might need code
fix also on project side depends on what new in that
version.

If project does not have cap the hacking version then,
there is possibility of gate failure whenever new hacking
version is released by QA team.

Example of such failure in recent release of hacking 1.1.0
- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-May/130282.html
(cherry picked from commit ccd542f7ea26d792ca8a07539f66fac6dfddbfb9)

Fix deploy-guide links

Deploy guides includes quickstart guide.
Includes respect relative paths, but when
quickstart includes vagrant doc, deploy-guide
tries to locate the doc in its doctree (deploy-guide/source).

This causes error 404 and deploy-guide post-gates to fail
(cherry picked from commit 197a264a3b772f9d6c9c9775bf00357e2a7a9a10)

Change-Id: I05790c5f946a4127fe6c8d9867cc618cb83d67fb

commit_message:
Remove unnecessary BRs for keystone

Remove following not required BRs for keystone:-
- tempest
- os-api-ref
- reno
- python-subunit
- oslosphinx

Also add "openstackdocstheme" BR for docs and "which" for
tests.
"openstackdocstheme" was indirectly included by os-api-ref
and "which" by tempest before this patch.

Change-Id: Iebb73452d4a168f7469713b7f7afa71230988ff8

commit_message:
Retry restarting systemd-journald

It is possible that systemd-journald fails to properly restart on
the first attempt due to assertion errors similar to the following:

  Assertion 'f' failed at src/journal/journal-file.c:132,
  function journal_file_close(). Aborting.

However, the service eventually starts with no problems, so we can
simply retry which will let it restart cleanly on the next attempt.

Change-Id: Ic65466b0d339c5a1b476e91483beca248ed0a02d
(cherry picked from commit 66ed618bce2c56a36e803d43ba6695dc3d64f0f3)

commit_message:
Update Nagios check for Luminous

This adds a test to see if the ceph status output looks like Luminous or
newer, and if so changes the output used to collect info.

Change-Id: I98d194c329aace3c412701e06632dbfedfadefc7
Closes-Bug: #1756864

Add 'nova-designate-relation-broken' hook

which is required to update nova-compute configuration files when
removing the legacy relation with designate.

commit_message:
Replace reference to `nova.rc` with `openrc`

In reference to:

commit_message:
Update auth_uri option to www_authenticate_uri

Option auth_uri from group keystone_authtoken is deprecated[1].
Use option www_authenticate_uri from group keystone_authtoken.

[1]https://review.openstack.org/#/c/508522/

commit_message:
Add designate-bind monitoring capability

This patch modifies Bind to listen also on localhost for rndc commands
so that monitoring agents can poll for status, and configuring Bind
to post statistical data in named.stats file.

	modified:   src/templates/named.conf
	modified:   src/templates/named.conf.options

Closes-Bug: #1752611
Change-Id: I219d29bfccb4565b8732882ee62aec9b847b3070

commit_message:
Add binary installation for PIP

This patch adds support in order to be able to install PIP from
the upstream repo.  Due to the fact that most binary deployemnts
currently ship some iteration of pip 8.x, change the integration
checks to make sure that we have pip 8.x rather than a pinned
version

Depends-On: I21d18b21b22ed263682477e50992eba9ebd00798
Change-Id: If3079823ad1ed7998dc5c91c554c78cdc99fffa5

added_lines: pip_install_method: source

commit_message:
Add Glance installation from binary

This patch adds support to install Glance from RDO with a few
differences from source installs

- Binary deploys don't install systemd files
- Binary deploys use upstream recommended deployment method
- Therefore, RDO installs will not use UWSGI.

Depends-On: If3079823ad1ed7998dc5c91c554c78cdc99fffa5
Change-Id: Ic5de80f92b04f279643d3a8a205da5fbe3a8bb63

subject: Using assertIsNone() instead of assertEqual(None)
revisions:

Following OpenStack Style Guidelines:
[1] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/hacking/#unit-tests-and-assertraises
[H203] Unit test assertions tend to give better messages for more specific
assertions. As a result, assertIsNone(...) is preferred over
assertEqual(None, ...) and assertIs(..., None)

Change-Id: Ib5dcf2f389dd76f99d87ad22268695f2a702e6b3
'}]
commit_message:
Using assertIsNone() instead of assertEqual(None)

Following OpenStack Style Guidelines:
[1] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/hacking/#unit-tests-and-assertraises
[H203] Unit test assertions tend to give better messages for more specific
assertions. As a result, assertIsNone(...) is preferred over
assertEqual(None, ...) and assertIs(..., None)

Change-Id: Ib5dcf2f389dd76f99d87ad22268695f2a702e6b3

commit_message:
Ensure that comments are not counted

With the previous grep, it was possible that any commented nameserver
entries would be counted.  This patch fixes that.

Change-Id: I9925cb9a71c1b58dcf12f70d8ce0872386732f06
Closes-Bug: #1768725

commit_message:
also make newton use over-as-under

RDO Phase 2 failing on old release config for newton.
We need newton updated to use overcloud-as-undercloud.

Change-Id: Id6a17dfdcb4c35864ed8c71ccff1954d7fbbed4a

commit_message:
set the openstack release dynamically

Allow the release to be set more dynamically.
Allow the release to change while running
ansible

Change-Id: Iee5549e6497fe1ce44ba18c7173fb0e5dc92a465

commit_message:
Add broker support for passing app_name

In Ceph >= Luminous, application name needs to be set
on a per-pool level to avoid health warnings. This
change adds support for sending the application name
over the broker channel from consuming charms.

When a name is not sent from the other side of the
relation, the application name will be set to "unknown"
in Luminous and greater

Change-Id: I1109251b08da20adaf3d677c38fc1aacfba29439
Closes-Bug: #1753640
Depends-On: I99ae47b6802f50ea019751ffa328f11567cca567

Pick the correct validator based on OpenStack release. Expected data should be in the v2 format: { 'id': id, 'region': region, 'adminurl': adminurl, 'internalurl': internalurl, 'publicurl': publicurl, 'service_id': service_id} """ validation_function = self.validate_v2_endpoint_data xenial_queens = OPENSTACK_RELEASES_PAIRS.index('xenial_queens') if openstack_release and openstack_release >= xenial_queens: validation_function = self.validate_v3_endpoint_data expected = { 'id': expected['id'], 'region': expected['region'], 'region_id': 'RegionOne', 'url': self.valid_url, 'interface': self.not_null, 'service_id': expected['service_id']} return validation_function(endpoints, admin_port, internal_port, public_port, expected) def validate_v2_endpoint_data(self, endpoints, admin_port, internal_port, public_port, expected): def convert_svc_catalog_endpoint_data_to_v3(self, ep_data): """Convert v2 endpoint data into v3. { 'service_name1': [ { 'adminURL': adminURL, 'id': id, 'region': region. 'publicURL': publicURL, 'internalURL': internalURL }], 'service_name2': [ { 'adminURL': adminURL, 'id': id, 'region': region. 'publicURL': publicURL, 'internalURL': internalURL }], } """ self.log.warn("Endpoint ID and Region ID validation is limited to not " "null checks after v2 to v3 conversion") for svc in ep_data.keys(): assert len(ep_data[svc]) == 1, "Unknown data format" svc_ep_data = ep_data[svc][0] ep_data[svc] = [ { 'url': svc_ep_data['adminURL'], 'interface': 'admin', 'region': svc_ep_data['region'], 'region_id': self.not_null, 'id': self.not_null}, { 'url': svc_ep_data['publicURL'], 'interface': 'public', 'region': svc_ep_data['region'], 'region_id': self.not_null, 'id': self.not_null}, { 'url': svc_ep_data['internalURL'], 'interface': 'internal', 'region': svc_ep_data['region'], 'region_id': self.not_null, 'id': self.not_null}] return ep_data def validate_svc_catalog_endpoint_data(self, expected, actual, openstack_release=None): """Validate service catalog endpoint data. Pick the correct validator for the OpenStack version. Expected data should be in the v2 format: { 'service_name1': [ { 'adminURL': adminURL, 'id': id, 'region': region. 'publicURL': publicURL, 'internalURL': internalURL }], 'service_name2': [ { 'adminURL': adminURL, 'id': id, 'region': region. 'publicURL': publicURL, 'internalURL': internalURL }], } """ validation_function = self.validate_v2_svc_catalog_endpoint_data xenial_queens = OPENSTACK_RELEASES_PAIRS.index('xenial_queens') if openstack_release and openstack_release >= xenial_queens: validation_function = self.validate_v3_svc_catalog_endpoint_data expected = self.convert_svc_catalog_endpoint_data_to_v3(expected) return validation_function(expected, actual) def validate_v2_svc_catalog_endpoint_data(self, expected, actual): "".format(rel.get('api_version'), api_version)) def authenticate_cinder_admin(self, keystone, api_version=2): self.log.debug('Authenticating cinder admin...') return _clients[api_version](session=keystone.session) if not api_version: api_version = 2 sess, auth = self.get_keystone_session( keystone_ip=keystone_ip, username=username, password=password, api_version=api_version, admin_port=admin_port, user_domain_name=user_domain_name, domain_name=domain_name, project_domain_name=project_domain_name, project_name=project_name ) if api_version == 2: client = keystone_client.Client(session=sess) else: client = keystone_client_v3.Client(session=sess) # This populates the client.service_catalog client.auth_ref = auth.get_access(sess) return client def get_keystone_session(self, keystone_ip, username, password, api_version=False, admin_port=False, user_domain_name=None, domain_name=None, project_domain_name=None, project_name=None): """Return a keystone session object""" ep = self.get_keystone_endpoint(keystone_ip, api_version=api_version, admin_port=admin_port) if api_version == 2: else: return (sess, auth) def get_keystone_endpoint(self, keystone_ip, api_version=None, admin_port=False): """Return keystone endpoint""" port = 5000 if admin_port: port = 35357 base_ep = "http://{}:{}".format(keystone_ip.strip().decode('utf-8'), port) if api_version == 2: ep = base_ep + "/v2.0" else: ep = base_ep + "/v3" return ep def get_default_keystone_session(self, keystone_sentry, openstack_release=None): """Return a keystone session object and client object assuming standard default settings Example call in amulet tests: self.keystone_session, self.keystone = u.get_default_keystone_session( self.keystone_sentry, openstack_release=self._get_openstack_release()) The session can then be used to auth other clients: neutronclient.Client(session=session) aodh_client.Client(session=session) eyc """ self.log.debug('Authenticating keystone admin...') api_version = 2 client_class = keystone_client.Client # commit_message:
tempest plugins only need to be installed on convert for newton

modify roles/convert-image/templates/convert_image.sh.j2
in tripleo-quickstart to selectively install tempest
packages, which are needed only for newton

Change to add the packages started here
https://review.gerrithub.io/#/c/271048/ and was ported
to all the following evolutions.
It's needed only for newton.

Change-Id: I94fd32e7a7c7512f2a30c05ee45bc70645fb1613

commit_message:
auto-unlock: Use correct key for root token

Align retrieval name for auto-unlocked root token with consuming
code, fixing issues with auto-unlock mode.

Store local charm access approle id for subsequent charm use.

Change-Id: Ie50a46db2f6a5f7a5a181372743e1c03d7868778

commit_message:
Handle PortNotFoundClient exception when getting ports

There could be a race between deleting an instance and retrieving its
port groups from Neutron. In this case PortNotFoundClient is raised and
it can be safely ignored.

Change-Id: I31c9ea8628c6f3985f8e9118d9687bbfb8789b68
Closes-Bug: #1767058

commit_message:
Add ssh-user to get_tripleo_ansible_inventory

We were missing --ssh-user when calling
get_tripleo_ansible_inventory assigning
overcloud as the ssh_user by default.

This is failing after adding the --stack option
as he had only one before

subject: Relocate libvirt-sock from /run to /home
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-02-21 20:40:08.000000000', 'files': ['roles/undercloud-deploy/tasks/configure-vbmc.yml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart-extras/commit/3a83d6820fe304bbf9b0f4d92d0da94b015937fc', 'message': 'Relocate libvirt-sock from /run to /home

On one of the local test systems, quickstart.sh aborts when
trying to run "openstack overcloud node introspect" (in task
overcloud-prep-images). This happens because the VirtualBMC
service fails to start (virtualbmc@control_0.service etc.).
The service fails because it tests if the supplied URL for
libvirt is useable, and it's not. An access to it fails because
/run/user/1000 does not exist on the host.

Our speculation is that normally, we log in to stack@virthost
and run virsh, which starts libvirtd. The logging-in makes the
systemd-logind mount /run/user/1000, which is normal. When we
log out, libvirtd keeps the socket open and thus /run/user/1000
continues to exist. However, the system in question is so slow,
that libvirtd gets bored and exits, and systemd-logind umounts
the directory. When VBMC comes around to probe, the ssh connection
for qemu+ssh:// does not trigger systemd-logind and the directory
/run/user/1000 does not exist, which makes the proble to abort.

This is associated with "su - stack" not mounting /run/user/1000
(although ssh stack@virthost does so). It's a separate story why
that happens, the files in /etc/pam.d/ appear to require it
working, but something prevents it.

The fix or workaround for now is to avoid /run/user/1000 and
use the /home/stack/.cache, at least as long as we support
RHEL 7 and CentOS 7.

Change-Id: I92b5f0cc5f02aee275d80f41cb8fc920df6b1e14
'}]
commit_message:
Relocate libvirt-sock from /run to /home

On one of the local test systems, quickstart.sh aborts when
trying to run "openstack overcloud node introspect" (in task
overcloud-prep-images). This happens because the VirtualBMC
service fails to start (virtualbmc@control_0.service etc.).
The service fails because it tests if the supplied URL for
libvirt is useable, and it's not. An access to it fails because
/run/user/1000 does not exist on the host.

Our speculation is that normally, we log in to stack@virthost
and run virsh, which starts libvirtd. The logging-in makes the
systemd-logind mount /run/user/1000, which is normal. When we
log out, libvirtd keeps the socket open and thus /run/user/1000
continues to exist. However, the system in question is so slow,
that libvirtd gets bored and exits, and systemd-logind umounts
the directory. When VBMC comes around to probe, the ssh connection
for qemu+ssh:// does not trigger systemd-logind and the directory
/run/user/1000 does not exist, which makes the proble to abort.

This is associated with "su - stack" not mounting /run/user/1000
(although ssh stack@virthost does so). It's a separate story why
that happens, the files in /etc/pam.d/ appear to require it
working, but something prevents it.

The fix or workaround for now is to avoid /run/user/1000 and
use the /home/stack/.cache, at least as long as we support
RHEL 7 and CentOS 7.

Change-Id: I92b5f0cc5f02aee275d80f41cb8fc920df6b1e14
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart-extras refs/changes/69/546769/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # XXX possibly remove this if it's not used anymore (for /run/user/NNN)# XXX Make sure ~stack/.cache/libvirt is created, but how? vbmc_libvirt_uri: "qemu+ssh://{{ non_root_user }}@{{ vbmc_address }}/session?socket=/home/{{ non_root_user_uid }}/.cache/libvirt/libvirt-sock&keyfile=/root/.ssh/id_rsa_virt_power&no_verify=1&no_tty=1"

commit_message:
Decouple release from overcloud_release

Our workarounds were using release variable which defines
version of undercloud not overcloud. We need to make sure
we do overcloud workarounds on overcloud_release and
undercloud workarounds on release.

Change-Id: Id58685f2dca5821f0b1a7ee0da23e630bd6e6f49

commit_message:
clean ansible facts cache

if deploy same VIRTHOST twice and enable ansible facts cache,
will failed by generate inventory.

Change-Id: I2059fdca6e66f5dff50c324a31ac75bc99464b4e

commit_message:
WIP DNR Add undercloud ~/.ssh/config to simplify development

Typing 'ssh heat-admin@...' and then confirming 'yes' is quite
annoying when doing lots of development. Let's avoid that.

Change-Id: I07dc2b58f555587415f4946b9451dccd12511b07
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart-extras refs/changes/32/510332/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Host * User heat-admin StrictHostkeyChecking no UserKnownHostsFile /dev/null

commit_message:
revist lifecycle_hook logic

    1. use one "Message" object to sink event
    2. add physical_id which is the actual to the event message
    3. check both node status and physical id before send event
    4. remove the actions that can be executed immediately from "child"
    to reduce DB interactions

Change-Id: Ie34fa1a44b575644685dc400fd70deb160c5c2e5

added_lines: resource_id, lifecycle_transition_type): "resource_id": resource_id,

commit_message:
Make UI accessable by default on OVB

A recent OVB commit[1] opens port 3000 and adds a stack output for the
private IP of the undercloud server.

This change uses that to bind the UI to the private IP of the
undercloud so that the UI can be accessed via
http://<floating ip>:3000

This change also makes the OVB git repo a variable so that local
development of OVB changes is easier.

[1] https://github.com/cybertron/openstack-virtual-baremetal/commit/1b6f33ab08ec29892ac557d3b1d318ef3fb4dc27

Change-Id: Ib51a038331d3d86da74af9f8c904d9a282087da0
Closes-Bug: #1719490

subject: Allow OVB to attach undercloud to existing floating IP
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-09-21 22:02:37.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart-extras/commit/4de9b263faf94fb6f3489ad32236be6a27e0b5ff', 'message': 'Allow OVB to attach undercloud to existing floating IP

Currently a different floating IP is created for every OVB deployment,
but it is convenient for development environments to allow for having
a stable IP for accessing the undercloud.

This change adds the undercloud_floating_ip and
undercloud_floating_ip_id parameters so that OVB
undercloud-floating-existing environment can be used as an alternative
to the default undercloud-floating.

commit_message:
Allow OVB to attach undercloud to existing floating IP

Currently a different floating IP is created for every OVB deployment,
but it is convenient for development environments to allow for having
a stable IP for accessing the undercloud.

This change adds the undercloud_floating_ip and
undercloud_floating_ip_id parameters so that OVB
undercloud-floating-existing environment can be used as an alternative
to the default undercloud-floating.

Change-Id: Iad7e9e3c4da717fea28ec20e1d290a2510481a06

commit_message:
use virthost_user instead of non_root_user

in order to avoid confusion about which user is being used where,
tripleo-quickstart has replaced non_root_user with virthost_user and
undercloud_user.  This commit implements the same changes in
tripleo-quickstart-extras.

Change-Id: Ib68815660a633a987b80ea5e45627c0aa01c96f3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart-extras refs/changes/70/441570/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # the virthost_user id is not in the facts of the virthost when# and obtain the uuid of the virthost_user - name: get virthost virthost_user userid shell: id -u {{ virthost_user }} register: virthost_user_uid delegate_to: "{{ groups.virthost[0] }}" - name: set fact on virthost_user_uid set_fact: virthost_user_uid: "{{ virthost_user_uid.stdout }}" "qemu+ssh://{{ virthost_user }}@{{ networks[0].address }}/session?socket=/run/user/{{ virthost_user_uid }}/libvirt/libvirt-sock&keyfile=/root/.ssh/id_rsa_virt_power&no_verify=1&no_tty=1"
deleted_lines: # the non_root_user id is not in the facts of the virthost when# and obtain the uuid of the non_root_user - name: get virthost non_root_user userid shell: id -u {{ non_root_user }} register: non_root_user_uid delegate_to: virthost - name: set fact on non_root_user_uid set_fact: non_root_user_uid: "{{ non_root_user_uid.stdout }}" "qemu+ssh://{{ non_root_user }}@{{ networks[0].address }}/session?socket=/run/user/{{ non_root_user_uid }}/libvirt/libvirt-sock&keyfile=/root/.ssh/id_rsa_virt_power&no_verify=1&no_tty=1"

commit_message:
Remove overcloud_services default value

...and document the expected structure in README instead.

This default value would not result in creating a sensible overcloud
deployment, and as such was not useful as a default. Also, replicating
the tripleo-heat-templates default here and keeping it in sync would be
a needless maintenance chore. Therefore should simply remove the
default.

If the user wants to set composable_services: true, they should also set
their own overcloud_services list. If they forget to do so, OOOQ should
fail.

The default case is already handled well by defaulting
composable_services to false. In that case we don't use
overcloud_services variable at all and the default set of services is
taken from what tripleo-heat-templates define.

Change-Id: I39dcee5b41fd430475ff87a5628c7c4b0ecbd762

deleted_lines: * `overcloud_services`: structure specifying services for roles. See the overcloud-deploy role's defaults.yaml file for an example.

commit_message:
WIP: Give build-test-packages role the option to inject

This commit gives the build-test-packages role a new option: to specify
a package to be built in addition to sourcing from Zuul and Jenkins.
This would primarily be used to replicate failures and test fixes in a
CI scenario.

Change-Id: Ic74b52008c3ebaabecaf7e019013e5cf634654e8

commit_message:
Switch to Tempest run cli for running tempest

* tempest run command does not having *tempest_until_failure*
  flag. So it needs to be removed also.

* Currently ostestr is switched to stestr which breaks the stuff.
  It is better to switched to tempest run in order to avoid the
  effect.

Change-Id: Id7cbf37e9e98811271410d0ea04c87d5299c83e7

commit_message:
WIP: Add stack update role

This commit provides a role to run stack update operations and change
overcloud parameters. This will be useful for testing vairous
overcloud settings change possibilities in a CI setting.

Example usage:

- name: Run stack update with compute updates
  hosts: undercloud
  vars:
    - update_compute_nodes: true
  roles:
    - update-stack

Change-Id: I765c4d11da5f34c449cbcdcba97567f515d7051d

commit_message:
Use clean keystone URL in the keystone validation

Inventory variable overcloud_keystone_url gets its
value from stack's output 'KeystoneURL'
which might include the keystone version.
We need to get rid off the version, otherwise
undercloud validations fail at the time of
checking the Keystone endpoint [0].

[0] - https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-validations/blob/545e4924e30769eb06100be1b5b2cd64637cf76e/validations/openstack-endpoints.yaml#L28

Co-Authored-By: Jose Luis Franco <jfrancoa@redhat.com>
Story: #2001897

Change-Id: I3e900afd840a4a0504a573a1eabe80911f8f7881
(cherry picked from commit c8cefbd9e97e84c0525259d93256c26069bc4a95)

subject: Autofencing support
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-09-10 06:52:37.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart-extras/commit/29cff12d4649a8f6dfc901c41c0285c608b4ae40', 'message': 'DNR WIP Initial autofencing iptables support

This is an initial WIP to get oooq setup to configure autofencing.
It requires Ie3d9d524980f9b257042c0fea77a37a56c04abd4 in
instack-undercloud to be applied before running the undercloud install.
The dependant change-Id is on oooq and will set up the
fencing_config.yaml. In this change we open up iptables on the
undercloud so that the overcloud can actually talk ipmi to the vbmc.

Depends-On: I747a24eda7dd9ef7aa32e3113569edebb90239a8
Change-Id: Ia5a6e3b6ee328b290127e2842ff27effe6f786ee
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2017-10-03 20:13:19.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart-extras/commit/95fd08af9ff9a064b17db2cc0fa621295612beb5', 'message': "WIP Initial autofencing support

With this change we introduce the 'enable_autofencing' parameter which
defaults to false. When enabled we create a fencing_config.yaml file
which contains all the necessary information for the overcloud to
configure IPMI-based stonith devices.

In order for the virtualbmc IPMI ports to be reachable we also create
an iptables rule to open up those ports for the overcloud.

NB: Is because I need to do some more tests end-to-end.

Depends-On: I0727a9224b5e9eaafaa374ecfbcd4fb9ccb52d58
Change-Id: Ia5a6e3b6ee328b290127e2842ff27effe6f786ee
"}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2017-10-06 05:54:24.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart-extras/commit/3e2ebd0ca2f0490ee819ac57db0f27d3f5877963', 'message': "WIP Initial autofencing support

With this change we introduce the 'enable_autofencing' parameter which
defaults to false. When enabled we create a fencing_config.yaml file
which contains all the necessary information for the overcloud to
configure IPMI-based stonith devices.

In order for the virtualbmc IPMI ports to be reachable we also create
an iptables rule to open up those ports for the overcloud.

NB: Is because I need to do some more tests end-to-end.

commit_message:
Autofencing support

With this change we introduce the 'enable_autofencing' parameter which
defaults to false. When enabled we create a fencing_config.yaml file
which contains all the necessary information for the overcloud to
configure IPMI-based stonith devices.

In order for the virtualbmc IPMI ports to be reachable we also create
an iptables rule to open up those ports for the overcloud.

With this option on, we correctly get stonith autoconfigured:
[root@overcloud-controller-0 ~]# pcs stonith
 stonith-fence_ipmilan-00b723a39acb (stonith:fence_ipmilan): Started overcloud-controller-0
 stonith-fence_ipmilan-00b723a39ac7 (stonith:fence_ipmilan): Started overcloud-controller-1
 stonith-fence_ipmilan-00b723a39ac3 (stonith:fence_ipmilan): Started overcloud-controller-2

Depends-On: I0727a9224b5e9eaafaa374ecfbcd4fb9ccb52d58
Change-Id: Ia5a6e3b6ee328b290127e2842ff27effe6f786ee

commit_message:
Use 'cat' instead of 'echo' to create file

An empty file (validate-template-override.yaml)
will be created when using 'echo', which in turn
causes pingtest fail.

Change-Id: I18552b406610c3c03635e04c63eaae688575a647

commit_message:
Use testr failing --list to determine tempest status

* on running testr failing --list exit status will return 0
  if all the tests are passed and if any tests has failed. It will
  list failing tests and exit status will be 1.

* It is the best way to determine the tempest run status.

Change-Id: I5d3230368463ce40114541a5eda409b49df8d360

commit_message:
Support release change during playbook run

Sometimes it's neeeded to change release of tripleo distribution
during the run (in upgrades for example), this patch add suppoort
for this:
 - Remove enforcing of release from quickstart.sh
 - Move default release to repo-setup role
 - Use include_vars in repo-setup role for loading release vars,
   passing var "release_config" to role will define which release
   file will be included.
 - Continue support of -R|--release argument in quickstart, it will
   remain for backward compatibility and running playbooks with one
   release only.

Change-Id: Ia62281c232e6ccaee4feaeb01b5c9a122350bf64

subject: Allow customizing the hard-drive Serial and/or WWN
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-29 11:23:57.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart/commit/ecfb4b2b5a8d6aeef6485339fe82b0ff8450f14c', 'message': 'Allow customizing the hard-drive Serial and/or WWN

This patch allows specifying a disk Serial and/or WWN for the overcloud
VMs. Ironic has a feature called "root device hints" which allows

commit_message:
Allow customizing the hard-drive Serial and/or WWN

This patch allows specifying a disk Serial and/or WWN for the overcloud
VMs. Ironic has a feature called "root device hints" which allows
operators to use disk attributes such as: model, size, serial, wwn,
etc... to specify which disk the image should be deployed onto.

By allowing it to be specified we can then exercise this feature from
Ironic with tripleo-quickstart.

This patch also changes the default disk controller from virtio to scsi
in the overcloud nodes because such attributes are not part of virtio in
libvirt.

Co-Authored-By: Dmitry Tantsur <dtantsur@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I4d862ee0c16f679a117c20201c6a884224586b25
Closes-Bug: #1645673
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart refs/changes/56/404156/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: libvirt_diskdev: sda libvirt_diskbus: scsi

commit_message:
Decouple release from overcloud_release

Our workarounds were using release variable which defines
version of undercloud not overcloud. We need to make sure
we do overcloud workarounds on overcloud_release and
undercloud workarounds on release.

Change-Id: Ibcf65485e5f1793a4b005bee73e0d42925b3a442

commit_message:
Update release note for resolvconf cache prep failure

The previously recommended method got it past the cache prep, but
failed later due to a missing resolver configuration when the
container started. This additional change fixes that.

Change-Id: I196f4e29cfef5f0eb0fcacf898ded877672d99f9
Related-Bug: #1768592

commit_message:
Enable the image signing feature in scenario 2

Adding this tempest option will force python-tempestconf to
create signed images in the test environment.  This is needed
so that tests will continue to pass when glance signature
vverification is enabled in nova.

Depends-On: I7186e5904bf5c4843b85436c2d081e50007931ff
Change-Id: Ie62025da5bd3ea495ef706f2cd18860a94c27e16

commit_message:
modify basic test to use non-default non_root_user

we expect operators to be able to set non_root_user in their
configuration, but we do not respect this value in our playbooks.
This modifies basic.sh to us  a non-default value for non_root_user to
flush out these issues.

Change-Id: I98487b98fea5f6549790bebb4da744d07f68eed3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart refs/changes/55/439055/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: -e non_root_user=stack0 \

commit_message:
DO NOT REVIEW test ovb-ha against RDO latest builds

http://trunk.rdoproject.org/centos7-master/current-tripleo/ repo
is > 2 weeks behind and has e.g. too old neutron-lib

Testing related fix for https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1696094

Change-Id: Idcfee2fa03e0d3f907b042debbec8ab43087ed78
